name: Forensic Identification Field School
description: A field course to complement the material covered in both FSC300H, Forensic Identification & FSC302H, Advanced Forensic Identification. The field school will be held on the U of T Mississauga Campus over a 2-week period during the summer term and during weekly two hour labs in the fall term. In these classes, students will experience practical exposure to field and laboratory methods related to evidence recognition, collection and interpretation. Emphasis will be placed on the types of evidence collected, processed, and analyzed by forensic identification specialists. General evidence and small object photography techniques will be an important component of the course. [104P] (Priority given first to Forensic Science Specialists and Majors; then Minors.)ÿLimited Enrolment and Course Application required. Application Process see:https://www.utm.utoronto.ca/forensic/applications
